a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Share of children who have anemia
Share of children under the age of five with anemia. Anemia is a condition that develops when your blood lacks
enough healthy red blood cells or hemoglobin.
Data source: World Health Organization (via World Bank) (2025)
Note: Anemia is defined as hemoglobin levels lower than 110 grams per liter at sea level. Altitude can affect hemoglobin levels, requiring
adjustments to the threshold for diagnosing anemia.
